bioghist.p: Villanova University traces its origins to old Saint Augustine's Church in Philadelphia, which the Augustinians founded in 1796, and to its parish school, Saint Augustine's Academy, established in 1811. Villanova University has been sponsored by the Augustinian Order since its founding in 1842. Today, the University is comprised of five colleges: Liberal Arts and Sciences (Villanova College), Engineering, School of Business (formerly known as the College of Commerce and Finance), Nursing and the School of Law.

scopecontent.p: The Vice President record group consists of the following series: Multicultural Affairs, Office of Planning, Training and Institutional Research (OPTIR), and University Information Technologies (UNIT). Materials related to multicultural affairs include correspondence, printed materials, and reports. The records of the Office of Planning, Training and Institutional Research consist of the following sub-series: Administrative, Minutes, Programs, and Reports. The bulk of the collection is made up of reports. Topics include student surveys, organization plans and job descriptions, campus climate survey, strategic planning for a number of academic and support departments, and a foundation profile survey. Records in the the University Information Technologies (UNIT) series include printed materials, reports, handbooks, and proposals for media technology (1967-1998), including a 1970 computer user handbook and an annual report on University Information Technologies, 1997-1998.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
